definition: opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The quality of the cinematography is quite good, except for a little shakiness in the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 這部片攝影品質相當好，除了片頭出現輕微搖晃。

sentences.english: Rolling captions are offen used in movie or TV head and end.
sentences.chinese: 滾動字幕是電影或電視中片頭和片尾經常使用的手段。

sentences.english: In the future, it will be hard to hear the lion roar often heard at the beginning of many classic movies.
sentences.chinese: 許多經典電影片頭的獅子吼以後可能很難聽到了。

sentences.english: I think deeply that how makes titles often.
sentences.chinese: 我常常在製作時思考怎麼做片頭。

sentences.english: It seems with every movie they add more previews .
sentences.chinese: 似乎每部電影之前都會加許多片頭。

sentences.english: This article discussed the education television piece film title design art with emphasis.
sentences.chinese: 討論電視教育片的片頭設計藝術。

definition: Wong Kar-wai (1956-), Hong Kong film director
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
dialogue (in a movie or a play)
anew/from the beginning/(in poetry and song) repetition of a melody or rhythm
